bioghist.p: Villanova University first offered a program of study leading to a Bachelor of Sciences in Nursing Education in 1932. This commitment was expanded in 1953 to created a College of Nursing that now offers a generic BSN program, a BSN completion program for registered nurses, an accelerated BSN program for second degree students, and a MSN program, a Ph.D. program and a Continuing Education program. The College of Nursing is approved by the State Board of Nursing of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania. Upon completion of the undergraduate program, graduates are eligible to take the licensing examination (NCLEX) for professional registered nurses. This license is transferable within the United States nationally by state. The undergraduate and graduate programs are both fully accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education. The Nurse Anesthesia concentration in the graduate program is accredited by the Council on Accreditation of Nurse Anesthesia Educational Programs. The Continuing Education Program is accredited as a provider of Continuing Education in Nursing by the American Nurses Credentialing Center, Commission on Accreditation.

scopecontent.p: The Undergraduate Nursing Program Records contain syllabi (faculty and student), examinations, student materials, study guides, course evaluation forms, rotation schedules, and manuals.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
